attributes.action: Stop the proposal to monitor online activity
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
"UK Gov't Creating Centralized Snooping Silo to monitor all Calls, Texts, Emails, IMs and Surf Histories" (Including who you speak to on Facebook!!)

This is a petition to stop the proposal to monitor activity on social networking sites in the UK. These sites contain private and sensitive details that should not be entrusted to any government.

Case example of government handling of sensitive data, November 2007...

"UK's families put on fraud alert

Two computer discs holding the personal details of all families in the UK with a child under 16 have gone missing.

The Child Benefit data on them includes name, address, date of birth, National Insurance number and, where relevant, bank details of 25 million people.”

Do we really want the UK government storing information on us, only to lose them all Again?!

Please sign the petition and invite your friends to do so too

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
